questions.question: Yesterday’s ……………………. was due to unexpected problems with electricity production.
questions.description: Black out: loss of electricity complete darkening of a room when lights are put out sudden loss of memory

questions.question: Susie will go ……………………….. with envy when she sees your new car.
questions.description: To go green with envy is to be very jealous of objects belonging to other people.

questions.question: He is not the kind of guy you can depend on when you are in trouble. He’s ……………………..
questions.description: Be yellow means be a coward.

questions.question: A lot of people want to adopt babies. It is the ……………………….. tape that discourages them.
questions.description: Red tape = delay in public affairs because there is too much attention to rules.

questions.question: James was neither brilliant nor hardworking. His Dad always treated him like a ………………………….. sheep.
questions.description: Black sheep = person of bad character

questions.question: Mr. Mathews is going to take over as the next chairman. Be sure to roll out the ………………………….. carpet when he arrives.
questions.description: Roll out the red carpet = Give the best treatment

questions.question: They have just purchased a new home in the ………………………… belt.
questions.description: Green belt = the countryside around a city

questions.question: The situation is not as ……………………….. as you think.
questions.description: Black and white = When something is black and white, it is clear, simple and understandable.

questions.question: I’m feeling rather …………………………… these days. Have you got something to cheer me up?
questions.description: To feel blue is to be depressed.

questions.question: He had to tell a ……………………………. lie to escape his mother’s punishment.
questions.description: White lie = A small insignificant lie.

questions.question: The civil authority has given the ………………………… light to the project.
questions.description: Give the green light = To give the green light is to approve a project.
